question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to provide information regarding the revised rates of dearness allowance payable to central government employees.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the effective date of the revised dearness allowance rates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The effective date of the revised dearness allowance rates is 01.01.2014.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage increase in dearness allowance from the previous rate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The percentage increase in dearness allowance is 10%.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the new dearness allowance rate for central government employees?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The new dearness allowance rate is 100% of the basic pay.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the period for which the revised dearness allowance rates are applicable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised dearness allowance rates are applicable from 01.01.2014 to 30.06.2014.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the coal companies as well as the power producers in the area do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The coal companies as well as the power producers in the area will set up continuous ambient air quality stations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will the results of monitoring be put on?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The results of monitoring will be put on the website of the respective State Pollution Control Boards.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will the location of the monitoring stations be decided?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The location of the monitoring stations will be decided in consultation with the SPCBs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the respective SPCBs / UTPCCs monitor?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The respective SPCBs / UTPCCs will monitor the pollution levels in these areas on a regular basis and if at any stage it is observed that the levels are going beyond the prescribed standards, the same will be immediately brought to the notice of CPCB as well as MoEF.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen in such a situation where the monitored levels are found to be beyond the prescribed standards?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In such a situation the moratorium will be re-imposed.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will be supported?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The implementation of the action plan will be supported.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will the results of the monitoring be hosted and communicated to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The results of the monitoring so carried out will be hosted on the website and also communicated to CPCB.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be involved in the implementation of the action plans?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The inter-alia representatives of locals and experts in the relevant field will be setup to oversee the implementation of the action plans.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the EACs / SEACs do during appraisal of projects?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The EACs / SEACs will take extra precaution during appraisal of projects to be located in these areas and prescribe stringent safeguard measures, so that the environmental quality is not deteriorated further in these areas.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can comments/feedback, if any, on implementation of action plans be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Comments/feedback, if any, on implementation of action plans may be sent to Chairman, CPCB (e-mail: cpcb@nic.in).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Circular No. 29/2020\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Health, Sultanate of Oman\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which department within the Ministry of Health issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Directorate General of Pharmaceutical Affairs and Drug Control, Muscat\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the product being recalled?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Stellar 100 and Stellar 150 ventilators\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the manufacturer of the recalled products?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA)\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the source of the recalled products?
question_answer_pairs.answer: http://apps.tga.gov.au/Prod/api/rn-detail.aspx?k=RC-2019-RN-01749-1\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the affected product numbers?
What are the serial numbers of the affected products?
Why are the products being recalled?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Due to an internal battery issue that could lead to life support device failure\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What action is required from consumers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Check their stock, contact their local agent for remedial action, and ensure the devices are used consistent with the instructions for use\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should consumers do prior to using the devices?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Perform a functional test including alarms as described in the \"Starting therapy\" section in the user guide\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should consumers do if the alarm sounds a test beep?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Check that the LED (visual indicator) for the alarm signal and the Alarm mute button flash\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who should healthcare professionals report any adverse events to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Director of Medical Device Control\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the contact email for reporting adverse events?
question_answer_pairs.answer: dg-pade@moh.gov.om\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Director General that signed the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Dr. Mohammed Hamdan Al Rubaie\n

What is the telephone number mentioned in the circular?
What is the fax number mentioned in the circular?
What is the email address mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: dg-pade@moh.gov.om\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the organization that issued this letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) issued this letter.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Chairman of AICTE?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Chairman of AICTE is Prof. Anil D. Sahasrabudhe.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Annual Refresher Programme in Teaching (ARPIT) available on online SWAYAM Platform.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is ARPIT?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ARPIT stands for Annual Refresher Programme in Teaching, which is a major and unique initiative towards online professional development of 1.5 million higher education faculty.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was this letter dated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This letter is dated 3rd December, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to encourage and incentivize faculty to join ARPIT and take advantage of the courses provided on the SWAYAM platform.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many discipline-specific National Resource Centres (NRCs) have been notified in the first phase?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 75 discipline-specific National Resource Centres (NRCs) have been notified in the first phase.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the task of these 75 NRCs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 75 NRCs are tasked to prepare online training material with a focus on latest developments in the discipline, new & emerging trends, pedagogical innovations and methodologies for transacting revised curriculum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many faculty members are expected to be catered to in 2018, the inaugural year of ARPIT?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The NRCs are expected to cater to around 13 lakh faculty of higher education in 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the emphasis of the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The emphasis is on capacity building and enhancement of the professional skills of the higher education faculty.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the PMMMNMTT scheme?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for submitting Property Returns by employees, including faculty, every year?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deadline is 31st January of every year.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What action would be taken against employees who fail to submit their Property Returns within the stipulated time?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They would be denied vigilance clearance in addition to taking action under conduct rules applicable to them.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who would submit the Property Returns to the authority?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All Heads of Institutions would submit their Property Returns to the authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What would the Heads of Institutions submit to the Divisional Heads?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They would submit a copy of said return to the Divisional Heads in the Department.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the administrative jurisdiction exercised by the Divisional Heads over the Organization/Institution?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Divisional Heads exercise the administrative jurisdiction over the Organization/Institution.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What would the Divisional Heads do to facilitate the timely submission of IPR?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Divisional Heads would submit a certificate of timely submission of IPR while seeking vigilance clearance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What would the Bureau Head do to ensure that the IPR submitted is notified on the website of the concerned Institution/Organization?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Bureau Head would also direct Divisional Heads to ensure that the IPR submitted is notified on the website of the concerned Institution/Organization.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What instructions would the Bureau Heads issue to all Divisions in the Bureau for effective implementation of the above instructions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Bureau Heads would issue necessary instructions to all Divisions in the Bureau for effective implementation of the above instructions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has signed the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is signed by the Joint Secretary & CVO, S.S. Sandhu.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom is the document addressed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to All Bureau Heads in the MHRD.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide instructions regarding the submission of Property Returns by employees, including faculty, and the consequences of non-submission.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the 31st January deadline for submitting Property Returns?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Employees who fail to submit their Property Returns by this deadline would be denied vigilance clearance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How would the Divisional Heads ensure that the IPR submitted is notified on the website?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Divisional Heads would direct the concerned Institution/Organization to ensure that the IPR submitted is notified on the website.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Divisional Heads in the submission of Property Returns?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Divisional Heads would receive a copy of the Property Returns submitted by the Heads of Institutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence for employees who fail to submit their Property Returns within the stipulated time?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They would be denied vigilance clearance in addition to taking action under conduct rules applicable to them.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who exercises the administrative jurisdiction over the Organization/Institution?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Divisional Heads exercise the administrative jurisdiction over the Organization/Institution.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What would the Heads of Institutions submit to the authority?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Heads of Institutions would submit their Property Returns to the authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What would the Bureau Head do to ensure that the IPR submitted is notified?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Bureau Head would also direct Divisional Heads to ensure that the IPR submitted is notified on the website of the concerned Institution/Organization.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the certificate of timely submission of IPR?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The certificate of timely submission of IPR is required while seeking vigilance clearance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What instructions would the Bureau Heads issue to all Divisions in the Bureau?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Bureau Heads would issue necessary instructions to all Divisions in the Bureau for effective implementation of the above instructions.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is Circular No. 148/04/2021-GST and the date is 04/2021-GST.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the decision of the Joint/Additional Commissioner mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The decision is on a request for extension of time limit for applying for revocation of cancellation of registration.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the proper officer required to process the application for revocation of cancellation of registration?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The proper officer shall process the application for revocation of cancellation of registration according to the law and procedure laid down in this regard.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure to be followed in case a person applies for revocation of cancellation of registration beyond a period of 60 days from the date of service of the order of cancellation of registration but within 90 days of such date?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The procedure similar to that explained in paragraph 4.1 to 4.3 above shall be followed mutatis-mutandis in such cases.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the circular cease to have effect?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular shall cease to have effect once the independent functionality for extension of time limit for applying in FORM GST REG-21 is developed on the GSTN portal.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the issuing authority of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is issued by Sanjay Mangal, Commissioner (GST).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be done if there are any difficulties in implementation of these instructions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Difficulties, if any, in implementation of these instructions may be informed to the Board (gst-cbec@gov.in).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for admission to Class V?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Candidate seeking admission must be born between 01-09-2004 and 31-08-2006, must have studied in Class-IV for the whole of the academic session of 2014-15 in a Government/Government aided or other recognized school, and must have studied continuously for TWO years in a Government/Government aided or other recognized school.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Candidate must have studied in Class V for the whole of the academic session of 2014-15 in a Government/Government aided or other recognized school.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Candidate must have studied in Class VII for the whole of the academic session of 2014-15 in a Government/Government aided or other recognized school.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the selection of candidates be done if the number of applications is less than the available vacancies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If the No. of applications are less than the available vacancies, then all the candidates may be provided admission.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the selection of candidates be done if the number of applications is more than the available vacancies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If No. of candidates are out numbered the vacancies, then the list is to be sent to the O/o the Secretary, APREI Society, Hyderabad for selection of candidates for admission through a committee.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the Principals verify before giving admission to the candidates in classes V/VI/VII and VIII?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Principals should verify the certificates pertaining to Date of birth, study certificate, community certificate, income certificate of the candidates before giving admission to the candidates in classes V/VI/VII and VIII.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the document is \"Notification\".\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The notification is dated 24/09/15.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the issuing authority of the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notification is issued by the Secretary (AR) of the National Capital Territory of Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the notification is to add certain positions to the list of Competent Authorities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the department added as a Competent Authority?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights is added as a Competent Authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights as per the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights is the Competent Authority for matters relating to the protection of Child Rights.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District South West-A) as per the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District South West-A) is in respect of matters relating to Government, Govt. Aided Schools, Unaided Recognized Private Schools and Zones/Branches under the jurisdiction of South West-A District.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District South West-B) as per the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District South West-B) is in respect of matters relating to Government, Govt. Aided Schools, Unaided Recognized Private Schools and Zones/Branches under the jurisdiction of South West-B District.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District South East) as per the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District South East) is in respect of matters relating to Government, Govt. Aided Schools, Unaided Recognized Private Schools and Zones/Branches under the jurisdiction of South East District.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District West-A) as per the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District West-A) is in respect of matters relating to Government, Govt. Aided Schools, Unaided Recognized Private Schools and Zones/Branches under the jurisdiction of West-A District.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District West-B) as per the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District West-B) is in respect of matters relating to Government, Govt. Aided Schools, Unaided Recognized Private Schools and Zones/Branches under the jurisdiction of West-B District.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District Central/New Delhi) as per the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education (District Central/New Delhi) is in respect of matters relating to Government, Govt. Aided Schools, Unaided Recognized Private Schools and Zones/Branches under the jurisdiction of Central District.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the addition of the positions mentioned in the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the addition of the positions is to empower the respective Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education to handle matters relating to Government, Govt. Aided Schools, Unaided Recognized Private Schools and Zones/Branches under their respective jurisdictions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education positions are added in the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There are 6 Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education positions added in the notification.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which districts are covered by the Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education positions added in the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The districts covered are South West-A, South West-B, South East, West-A, West-B, and Central/New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the notification in terms of the education system in Delhi?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notification empowers the Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education positions to handle matters related to Government, Govt. Aided Schools, Unaided Recognized Private Schools and Zones/Branches under their respective jurisdictions, which is important for the effective administration of the education system in Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the notification ensure the proper functioning of the education system in Delhi?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notification assigns specific responsibilities to the Deputy Director Education/Assistant Director of Education positions, which helps in the efficient management and oversight of the education system in the respective districts of Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the legal basis for the issuance of this notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notification is issued by the order and in the name of the Lt. Governor of the National Capital Territory of Delhi, which provides the legal authority for its issuance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Secretary (AR) mentioned in the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Secretary (AR) is the issuing authority of the notification, as indicated by the signature at the bottom of the document.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the addition of the Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights as a Competent Authority?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The addition of the Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights as a Competent Authority ensures that matters related to the protection of child rights are handled by a dedicated and specialized body.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to fill up a Non-Central Staffing Scheme post through the Civil Service Board (CSB) procedure.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the details required for the eligible candidates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The details required include name, date of birth, service, batch, contact telephone number, email address, educational qualifications, and complete CR dossiers/certified copies for the last five years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The post is for at least four years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will approve the appointment to this post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The approval of the Minister-in-charge concerned will be required.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When should the applications of the eligible candidates be forwarded?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The applications of the eligible candidates should be forwarded to the Department within one month from the date of issue of this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who should the applications be forwarded to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The applications should be forwarded to the Department.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The post is a Non-Central Staffing Scheme post to be filled up through the Civil Service Board (CSB) procedure.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for allotment of Government accommodation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It may be noted that no 'Mandatory Posting Certificate' for allotment/retention of Government accommodation will be issued by this office to the officer appointed on the above referred post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for those officers who have served and are currently serving on Central Staffing Scheme post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Those officers who have served and are currently serving on Central Staffing Scheme post will be issued a certificate to the effect that the officer concerned has served for at least four years in CSB post and she/he needs to retain Government accommodation for her/his tenure on non-CSS post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the officers that may be recommended for this post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The names of willing and eligible officers, who have been empanelled to hold the post of Secretary or equivalent posts at the Centre under the Central Staffing Scheme, may be recommended to this office.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for forwarding the applications?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is requested that the applications of the eligible candidates may be forwarded so as to reach this Department within one month from the date of issue of this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who should the applications be forwarded to?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for officers who have served and are currently serving on Central Staffing Scheme post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Those officers who have served and are currently serving on Central Staffing Scheme post will be issued a certificate to the effect that the officer concerned has served for at least four years in CSB post and she/he needs to retain Government accommodation for her/his tenure on non-CSS post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for allotment of Government accommodation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It may be noted that no 'Mandatory Posting Certificate' for allotment/retention of Government accommodation will be issued by this office to the officer appointed on the above referred post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Certification by the Employer/ Cadre Controlling Authority\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What information is being certified in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The information/details provided in the above application by the applicant are true and correct.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first point mentioned under \"Also certified that\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There is no vigilance or disciplinary case pending / contemplated against Shri / Smt.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second point mentioned under \"Also certified that\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: His / Her Integrity is certified.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the third point mentioned under \"Also certified that\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: His / Her Integrity Report File (CR Dossier) in original is enclosed. Photocopies of the ACRs for the last 5 years duly attested by an officer of the rank of Under Secretary of the Govt. of India or above are enclosed.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the fourth point mentioned under \"Also certified that\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No Major / Minor penalty has been imposed on him/her during the last 10 years OR A list of major/minor penalties imposed on him/her during the last 10 years is enclosed, (as the case may be).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has countersigned this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (Employer/ Cadre Controlling Authority with Seal)\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To certify the information provided in the application by the applicant.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the nature of the case mentioned in the second point under \"Also certified that\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Vigilance or disciplinary case.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the nature of the penalties mentioned in the fourth point under \"Also certified that\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Major or minor penalties.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of enclosing the Integrity Report File (CR Dossier) and photocopies of the ACRs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide evidence of the applicant's integrity and performance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has the authority to certify the information in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Employer/ Cadre Controlling Authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the seal on the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It authenticates the certification by the Employer/ Cadre Controlling Authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this certification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To confirm the accuracy of the information provided in the applicant's application.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the time period covered by the major/minor penalties mentioned in the fourth point?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The last 10 years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of mentioning the absence of any vigilance or disciplinary case?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To confirm the applicant's clean record.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of mentioning the applicant's integrity?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To vouch for the applicant's character and trustworthiness.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of enclosing the ACRs (Annual Confidential Reports)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide evidence of the applicant's performance and conduct.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the term \"Countersigned\" at the bottom of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It indicates that the certification has been approved and signed by the authorized authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document in the overall application process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide an official certification of the applicant's details and qualifications.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Circular No. 103/22/2019-GST\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to publicize the contents of this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is requested to be issued in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is requested that suitable trade notices may be issued to publicize the contents of this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What may be brought to the notice of the Board immediately as per this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Any difficulty, if any, in the implementation of this circular may be brought to the notice of the Board immediately.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This circular has been issued by the Principal Commissioner (GST).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of this circular is 103/22/2019-GST.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main subject matter of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The main subject matter of this circular is regarding the repairs, treatment or process of unpolished diamonds which are temporarily imported into India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition for unpolished diamonds imported into India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Unpolished diamonds which are temporarily imported into India are not put to any use in India, and the place of supply would be determined as per the provisions contained in sub-section (2) of Section 13 of the IGST Act.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for repairs or treatment of unpolished diamonds imported into India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Unpolished diamonds which are temporarily imported into India and are repaired or treated, should be exported after such repairs or treatment, and are not put to any use in India, other than that which is required for such repairs or treatment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision mentioned in this circular regarding cutting and polishing activity on unpolished diamonds?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In case of cutting and polishing activity on unpolished diamonds which are temporarily imported into India, the place of supply would be determined as per the provisions contained in sub-section (2) of Section 13 of the IGST Act.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the cases pending in grant sanctioning bureaus for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The cases pending in grant sanctioning bureaus are for preparation of draft sanction order for vetting by FD-III and allotment of FD diary no. after obtaining the sanction of competent authority during year 2017-18.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: In all such cases, what is the draft sanction order to be prepared for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In all such cases, the draft sanction order is to be prepared by grant sanctioning bureaus for financial year 2018-19 without seeking revised sanction of sanctioning authority for current financial year.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of obtaining the sanction of competent authority in such cases?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In such cases, the sanction of competent authority for financial year 2018-19 is to be obtained and sanction order is to be issued and payment to be made as per usual procedure.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which offices are required to note the above decisions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All the grants sanctioning bureaus Regional Offices and Finance Division, UGC are required to note the above decisions.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: It may also be ensured by the grants sanctioning bureaus, Regional Offices and Finance Division that all payments as stated in Para 1 (A) to (E) above and previous years pending sanctioned payments, if any, be made before the start of current year payments.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the statement of the area of the circle with radius 'r'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The area of the circle with radius 'r' is πr^2.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a sphere with radius 'r'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a sphere with radius 'r' is (4/3)πr^3.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a sphere with radius 'r'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a sphere with radius 'r' is 4πr^2.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a cylinder with radius 'r' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a cylinder with radius 'r' and height 'h' is πr^2h.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a cylinder with radius 'r' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a cylinder with radius 'r' and height 'h' is 2πr^2 + 2πrh.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a cone with radius 'r' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a cone with radius 'r' and height 'h' is (1/3)πr^2h.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a cone with radius 'r' and slant height 'l'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a cone with radius 'r' and slant height 'l' is πrl + πr^2.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a pyramid with base area 'A' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a pyramid with base area 'A' and height 'h' is (1/3)Ah.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a pyramid with base area 'A' and slant height 'l'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a pyramid with base area 'A' and slant height 'l' is A + (1/2)Pl, where P is the perimeter of the base.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a rectangular prism with length 'l', width 'w', and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a rectangular prism with length 'l', width 'w', and height 'h' is lwh.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a rectangular prism with length 'l', width 'w', and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a rectangular prism with length 'l', width 'w', and height 'h' is 2(lw + lh + wh).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a triangular prism with base area 'A' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a triangular prism with base area 'A' and height 'h' is Ah.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a triangular prism with base area 'A', height 'h', and slant height 'l'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a triangular prism with base area 'A', height 'h', and slant height 'l' is 2A + Pl, where P is the perimeter of the base.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a cube with edge length 's'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a cube with edge length 's' is s^3.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a cube with edge length 's'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a cube with edge length 's' is 6s^2.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a regular pyramid with base area 'A' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a regular pyramid with base area 'A' and height 'h' is (1/3)Ah.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a regular pyramid with base area 'A' and slant height 'l'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a regular pyramid with base area 'A' and slant height 'l' is A + (1/2)Pl, where P is the perimeter of the base.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a regular prism with base area 'A' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a regular prism with base area 'A' and height 'h' is Ah.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a regular prism with base area 'A', height 'h', and slant height 'l'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a regular prism with base area 'A', height 'h', and slant height 'l' is 2A + Pl, where P is the perimeter of the base.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a frustum of a cone with radii 'r1' and 'r2', and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a frustum of a cone with radii 'r1' and 'r2', and height 'h' is (1/3)π(r1^2 + r1r2 + r2^2)h.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a frustum of a cone with radii 'r1' and 'r2', and slant height 'l'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a frustum of a cone with radii 'r1' and 'r2', and slant height 'l' is π(r1 + r2)l + πr1^2 + πr2^2.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a sphere segment with base radius 'r' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a sphere segment with base radius 'r' and height 'h' is (1/6)πh(3r^2 + h^2).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a sphere segment with base radius 'r' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a sphere segment with base radius 'r' and height 'h' is 2πrh + πr^2.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a spherical sector with central angle 'θ' and radius 'r'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a spherical sector with central angle 'θ' and radius 'r' is (2/3)πr^3(θ/360).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a spherical sector with central angle 'θ' and radius 'r'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a spherical sector with central angle 'θ' and radius 'r' is 2πr^2(θ/360).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a spherical triangle with base area 'A' and height 'h'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a spherical triangle with base area 'A' and height 'h' is (2/3)Ah.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a spherical triangle with base area 'A' and slant height 'l'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a spherical triangle with base area 'A' and slant height 'l' is A + (1/2)Pl, where P is the perimeter of the base.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the volume of a spherical lune with central angle 'θ' and radius 'r'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The volume of a spherical lune with central angle 'θ' and radius 'r' is (2/3)πr^3(θ/360).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula for the surface area of a spherical lune with central angle 'θ' and radius 'r'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surface area of a spherical lune with central angle 'θ' and radius 'r' is 2πr^2(θ/360).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: NON-DISCLOSURE UNDERTAKING\n

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom is the document addressed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Joint Secretary (Admn.), Ministry of Power, Shram Shakti Bhawan, Rafi Marg, New Delhi-110001\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first undertaking mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To treat all the information that comes to my knowledge as part of my duties in this office as confidential information and keep it strictly confidential.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second undertaking mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Not to sell, trade, publish or otherwise disclose to any one in any manner whatsoever including by means of reproduction either in physical, hardcopy, digital or in electronic format.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the third undertaking mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To hold such confidential information in trust and confidence both during and after the terms of my engagement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the fourth undertaking mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Not to engage in any other employment/occupation/consultancy or any other activity during my engagement with Ministry of Power which would otherwise conflict with my obligations towards Ministry of Power.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the fifth undertaking mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To abide by data security policy and related guidelines issued by Ministry of Power.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the sixth undertaking mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Shall not resort any corrupt practices in any aspect and at any stage during the tenure of engagement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the person do in the event of termination of employment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Promptly surrender and deliver to Ministry of Power any records/material, equipment, documents or data which is of confidential nature.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the person keep the Ministry of Power informed during the period of engagement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: I shall keep Ministry of Power informed of any change in my address or contact details during the period of my engagement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the understanding regarding termination of the engagement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: I understand that I can be terminated at any point of time for breach of the above conditions and can be proceeded against under the relevant laws for the time being in force.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: For the purpose of this undertaking, Confidential Information means any information received from any source, whether in physical, electronic or in digital format.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What needs to be in place and onboard a revised Procedures and Arrangements manual?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A revised Procedures and Arrangements manual is needed for issuance of a Certificate of Fitness (COF) reflecting the new ship type criteria.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the eligibility period for the internship mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eligibility period for the internship is from 30th September, 2012 to 31st December, 2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where should the application be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The application should be sent to the Chief Executive Officer, Maritime Training Trust, Directorate General of Shipping, 7th Floor, Jahaz Bhavan, Walchand Hirachand Marg, Mumbai - 400 001.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the email address to send the application to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The email address to send the application to is: itc.dgshipping.com / maritimetrainingtrust@yahoo.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the selection of students for the internship at IMO, London be done?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The selection of students for the internship at IMO, London will be done by a sub-committee of Trustees of the MTI and intimation will be given to the selected student(s).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the estimated cost of sponsorship of an intern for a two-month stay in London?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The cost of sponsorship of an intern for a two-month stay in London is estimated at Rs. 6.50 lakhs per intern.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What portion of the cost will the student have to bear?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The student will have to bear one third of the cost (Rs. 2.17 lakhs) upfront and the balance two third will be borne by the MTI.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will pay the remaining two third of the cost after the student completes his three months assignment with the DGS or in such organization nominated by the DGS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The remaining two third of the cost will be paid on the completion of the internship at IMO, London and the balance one third of the cost after the student completes his three months assignment with the DGS or in such organization nominated by the DGS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: For how long will the student be required to work in the DGS or such organization nominated by the DGS after completion of the internship?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The student will be required to work in the DGS or such organization that the DGS nominates for a period of 3 months after completion of his internship.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many internships will be sponsored by the MTI for the FY 2012-13?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The number of internships to be sponsored by the MTI for the FY 2012-13 will be 5.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Chief Executive Officer of the Maritime Training Trust?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Chief Executive Officer of the Maritime Training Trust is (A. Raghavan).\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The address of the Directorate General of Shipping is 7th Floor, Jahaz Bhavan, Walchand Hirachand Marg, Mumbai - 400 001.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The maximum permitted duration of the internship at IMO, London is two months.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What portion of the cost of the internship will be borne by the MTI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Two third of the cost of the internship will be borne by the MTI.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The student(s) will be required to work in the DGS or such organization nominated by the DGS for a period of 3 months after completion of the internship.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of the circular is 7/15/2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to provide information regarding the GST DRC-07 form.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the GST DRC-07 form used for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GST DRC-07 form is used for the recovery of tax, interest, penalty, fee or any other amount.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the threshold limit for the applicability of the GST DRC-07 form?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The threshold limit for the applicability of the GST DRC-07 form is Rs. 5 crore.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision under which the GST DRC-07 form is issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GST DRC-07 form is issued under Section 122 (1) (ix) of the CGST Act.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of issuing the GST DRC-07 form?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of issuing the GST DRC-07 form is to recover the tax, interest, penalty, fee or any other amount.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the issuing authority for the GST DRC-07 form?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GST DRC-07 form is issued by the proper officer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the time period given to the taxpayer to make the payment after receiving the GST DRC-07 form?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The taxpayer is given 15 days to make the payment after receiving the GST DRC-07 form.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What happens if the taxpayer fails to make the payment within the given time period?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If the taxpayer fails to make the payment within the given time period, the proper officer may initiate recovery proceedings.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular has been issued by the Joint Secretary (Rajbhasha), Ministry of Home Affairs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the key points mentioned in the circular regarding the management of Rajbhasha activities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular provides instructions on the following key points: (a) Ensuring compliance with the provisions related to the official language, (b) Conducting Rajbhasha inspections and reviews, and (c) Implementing the decisions taken in the Rajbhasha Samiti (Official Language Committee) meetings.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of conducting Rajbhasha inspections and reviews as per the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of conducting Rajbhasha inspections and reviews is to assess the implementation of official language-related provisions and take necessary actions.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular mentions that the decisions taken in the Rajbhasha Samiti meetings should be implemented.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is addressed to all the Ministries/Departments/Offices and Autonomous Bodies of the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the Rajbhasha (official language) activities mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular emphasizes the importance of Rajbhasha activities and their proper management/administration/maintenance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the circular aim to ensure the effective implementation of Rajbhasha activities?

question_answer_pairs.answer: The announcement is of the list of provisionally selected candidates.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What right does the High Court for the State of Telangana, Hyderabad reserve?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The High Court reserves the right to increase, decrease the number of vacancies or cancel the notification at any stage, without assigning any reason thereof.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition for cancellation of the provisional selection of candidates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If the certificate of the provisionally selected candidates such as eligibility, education qualification, social status, and physical disability etc., are found to be incorrect at any stage of the recruitment.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The online application form contains two parts i.e., Part-A (One Time Profile Registration Form) and Part-B (Application Form).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the candidate get after completing Part-A?

question_answer_pairs.question: How can the candidate apply for different category of posts using the same OTPR ID?
question_answer_pairs.answer: By using the same OTPR ID, the candidate can apply for different category of posts.\n

file_name: img_lp_Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs_circularno-18-cgst.png

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Circular No. 18/18 (2017-GST)\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to provide information regarding the export of fabrics and the eligibility for refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on capital goods.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the issuing authority of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The issuing authority of this circular is the Technical Officer (TRU).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of this circular is 18/18/2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the circular, what are the two types of supplies that are eligible for export?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two types of supplies eligible for export are (a) exports of goods or services or both, or (b) supply of goods or services or both to a Special Economic Zone developer or a Special Economic Zone unit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision of the CGST Act, 2017 that is mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provision mentioned is sub-section (10) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be eligible for the refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on capital goods?
question_answer_pairs.answer: According to the circular, a manufacturer of such fabrics will be eligible for the refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on capital goods.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition for the manufacturer to be eligible for the refund?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The condition is that the fabrics should be manufactured and exported by him.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the manufacturer do to be eligible for the refund?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The manufacturer should claim the input tax credit of GST paid on capital goods in respect of fabrics manufactured and exported by him.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the difficulty, if any, in the implementation of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that any difficulty in the implementation of this circular should be brought to the notice of the Board.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has signed this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is signed by Ruchi Gupta, Technical Officer (TRU).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the document is \"Circular No. 18/18 (2017-GST)\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to provide information regarding the export of fabrics and the eligibility for refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the issuing authority of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The issuing authority of this circular is the Technical Officer (TRU).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of this circular is 18/18/2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two types of supplies mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two types of supplies mentioned are (a) exports of goods or services or both, and (b) supply of goods or services or both to a Special Economic Zone developer or a Special Economic Zone unit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the circular, what is the provision regarding the export of fabrics?
question_answer_pairs.answer: According to the circular, as regards export of fabrics, it is clarified that, subject to the provisions of sub-section (10) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017, a manufacturer of such fabrics will be eligible for refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs (other than capital goods) in respect of fabrics manufactured and exported by him.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the refund of unutilized input tax credit is to provide relief to the manufacturers of fabrics who export their products.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the scope of the refund of input tax credit mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The scope of the refund of input tax credit is limited to the input tax credit of GST paid on inputs (other than capital goods) in respect of fabrics manufactured and exported by the manufacturer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the legal provision mentioned in the circular regarding the refund of input tax credit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The legal provision mentioned is sub-section (10) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017.

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"E\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: E represents the Base Cost of Transmission Charges for the (n-2)th Month, which is the Approved Transmission Charges/12 in Rs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"Z\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Z represents the Actual Power purchased from Central Generating Stations having long/Medium/Short term PPA in the (n-2)th Month, in (kWh)* (1 - Inter-state transmission losses in % /100) + Power purchased from other GENCOs(in kWh)*(1 - Intra state losses in %) - B)/100 in kWh.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"ABR\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ABR represents the Average Billing Rate for the year (to be taken from the Tariff Order) in Rs/unit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"Distribution Losses (%)\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Distribution Losses (%) represent the Target Distribution Losses (from Tariff Order).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"Inter-state transmission Losses (in %)\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Inter-state transmission Losses (in %) represent 100* Approved Inter-state transmission losses in Tariff Order (kWh)/ Approved long term power purchase from central generating stations having long term PPA in the Tariff Order (kWh).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"Intra - State Losses (in %)\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Intra - State Losses (in %) represent As per Tariff Order.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the Power Purchase Cost exclude according to the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Power Purchase Cost shall exclude any charges on account of Deviation Settlement Mechanism (DSM).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What other charges are not included in FPPAS and adjusted through the true-up approved by the State Commission?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Other charges which include Ancillary Services and Security Constrained Economic Desptach (SCED) shall not be included in FPPAS and adjusted though the true-up approved by the State Commission.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"E\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: E represents the Base Cost of Transmission Charges for the (n-2)th Month, which is the Approved Transmission Charges/12 in Rs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"Z\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Z represents the Actual Power purchased from Central Generating Stations having long/Medium/Short term PPA in the (n-2)th Month, in kWh, which includes inter-state transmission losses in % /100 and power purchased from other GENCOs in kWh.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"ABR\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ABR represents the Average Billing Rate for the year (to be taken from the Tariff Order) in Rs/unit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"Distribution Losses (%)\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Distribution Losses (%) represent the Target Distribution Losses (from Tariff Order).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"Inter-state transmission Losses (%)\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Inter-state transmission Losses (%) represent the Approved Inter-state transmission losses in Tariff Order (kWh)/ Approved long term power purchase from central generating stations having long term PPA in the Tariff Order (kWh).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"Intra - State Losses (%)\" represent in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Intra - State Losses (%) represent the losses as per Tariff Order.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What charges are excluded from the Power Purchase Cost as per the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Power Purchase Cost shall exclude any charges on account of Deviation Settlement Mechanism (DSM).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What other charges are not included in the FPPAS and adjusted through the true-up approved by the State Commission?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Other charges which include Ancillary Services and Security Constrained Economic Desptach (SCED) shall not be included in FPPAS and adjusted though the true-up approved by the State Commission.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the formula used to calculate the Power Purchase Cost?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The formula is not explicitly provided in the image, but it can be inferred from the variables defined.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Power Purchase Cost formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to calculate the Power Purchase Cost, which excludes certain charges and adjusts for various losses and factors.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the Approved Transmission Charges in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Approved Transmission Charges are used to calculate the Base Cost of Transmission Charges for the (n-2)th Month.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the Inter-state transmission losses accounted for in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Inter-state transmission losses are included as a percentage of the Actual Power purchased from Central Generating Stations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the Intra-state losses accounted for in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Intra-state losses are included as per the Tariff Order.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the Average Billing Rate (ABR) in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ABR is used to convert the Power Purchase Cost into a per unit rate.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of excluding the Deviation Settlement Mechanism (DSM) charges from the Power Purchase Cost?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The DSM charges are excluded to avoid double counting or adjustments related to deviation settlement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Why are the Ancillary Services and Security Constrained Economic Desptach (SCED) charges not included in the FPPAS and adjusted through the true-up?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These charges are likely treated separately or through a different mechanism by the State Commission.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the Distribution Losses accounted for in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Distribution Losses are included as the Target Distribution Losses from the Tariff Order.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the long/medium/short term PPA in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Actual Power purchased from Central Generating Stations under different term PPAs is used to calculate the total power purchase quantity.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the power purchases from other GENCOs accounted for in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The power purchased from other GENCOs is included in the total Actual Power purchased quantity.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the true-up approved by the State Commission for the SCED and Ancillary Services charges?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The true-up allows for adjustments to these charges, which are not included in the FPPAS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the inter-state transmission losses expressed in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The inter-state transmission losses are expressed as a percentage of the Actual Power purchased from Central Generating Stations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the long term power purchase from central generating stations in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This long term PPA quantity is used to calculate the approved inter-state transmission losses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the intra-state losses accounted for in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The intra-state losses are included as per the Tariff Order, without any further calculation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of excluding the Deviation Settlement Mechanism (DSM) charges from the Power Purchase Cost?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The DSM charges are excluded to avoid double counting or adjustments related to deviation settlement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Why are the Ancillary Services and Security Constrained Economic Desptach (SCED) charges not included in the FPPAS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These charges are likely treated separately or through a different mechanism by the State Commission.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the power purchases from other sources, apart from Central Generating Stations, accounted for in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The power purchased from other GENCOs is included in the total Actual Power purchased quantity.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the Approved Transmission Charges in the calculation of the Base Cost of Transmission Charges?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Approved Transmission Charges are used as the basis to calculate the Base Cost of Transmission Charges for the (n-2)th Month.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the distribution losses accounted for in the formula?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The distribution losses are included as the Target Distribution Losses from the Tariff Order.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the true-up approved by the State Commission for the SCED and Ancillary Services charges?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The true-up allows for adjustments to these charges, which are not included in the FPPAS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the variable 'E' represent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The base cost of transmission charges for the (n-2)th month, which is the approved transmission charges/12 in Rs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the variable 'Z' represent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The actual power purchased from Central Generating Stations having long/medium/short term PPA in the (n-2)th month, in kWh, minus the inter-state transmission losses in % /100 and power purchased from other GENCOs in kWh.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the variable 'ABR' represent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The average billing rate for the year, to be taken from the Tariff Order in Rs/unit.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the compensation payable by the licensee to the generating company if the distribution licensee does not requisition power from a must-run power plant?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The compensation shall be payable by the licensee to the generating company owning the must-run power plant at the rate specified in the agreement for purchase of power.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the order of payment and adjustment towards late payment surcharge for the bills payable by a distribution licensee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All the bills payable by a distribution licensee to a generating company or a transmission company or a trading company for power procured from it, shall be time tagged with respect to the date and time of submission of the bill and the payment shall be made by the distribution licensee first against the oldest bill and then to the second oldest bill and so on so as to ensure that payment against a bill is not made unless and until all bills older than it have been paid for.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Electricity (Late Payment Surcharge) Rules, 2021 notified on 22nd February, 2021 repealed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Electricity (Late Payment Surcharge) Rules, 2021 notified on 22nd February, 2021 is hereby repealed.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What shall be deemed to have been done or taken under the Electricity (Late Payment Surcharge) Rules, 2021 notified on 22nd February, 2021?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken under the Electricity (Late Payment Surcharge) Rules, 2021 notified on 22nd February, 2021 shall be deemed to have been done or taken under the corresponding provisions of this Rule.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the technical standards mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The MOOC's Guidelines for developing Online Courses for SWAYAM for maintaining best standards, Video and Multimedia Contents shall meet highest Industry Standards, both in technical and academic terms.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The SWAYAM MOOC Guidelines are available at www.swayam.gov.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the AICTE being the 9th National Coordinator for SWAYAM?
question_answer_pairs.answer: AICTE being the 9th National Coordinator for SWAYAM accordingly invites proposals from \"Freelancers\" and \"Individuals\" who are not associated with any College/University.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the development of MOOCs on emerging technologies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is for the development of MOOCs on emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence, Nano Technology, Blockchain, Quantum Computing, Mixed Reality, Data Analytics, Indian Knowledge System, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the \"non-formal\" education as Self-Paced or Credit Course for SWAYAM MOOCs Platform?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to address the need to send 3 Three Minute Introduction Video and contents in not more than 3000 words of the proposed MOOC.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can submit proposals for the development of MOOCs on emerging technologies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Freelancers and Individuals who are not associated with any College/University can submit proposals.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for submitting the proposals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The last date for receipt of proposals can be extended further by AICTE.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will take the final decision to approve or reject the Course Contents/Course(s)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The final decision to approve or reject the Course Contents/Course(s) would be taken by the Academic Advisory Council (AAC) constituted by AICTE.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Academic Advisory Council (AAC) constituted by AICTE?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The AAC is constituted by AICTE for the purpose of approving or rejecting the Course Contents/Course(s) under the SWAYAM MOOC's Guidelines.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the applicability of said proviso to cotton, silk and other natural fibre fabrics?
question_answer_pairs.answer: According to the image, the said condition of lapsing of ITC would apply only if input tax credit on inputs has been accumulated on account of inverted duty structure.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How is the refund of accumulated ITC on exports separately determined?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The refund of such ITC on exports is separately determined under rule 89 (4).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does rule 89(5) ensure regarding accumulated ITC on exports?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Rule 89(5) ensures that accumulated ITC on exports does not lapse as this formula excludes zero rated supplies.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: It does not impose any restriction of refunds on zero rated supplies as was also clarified vide CGST circular no. 18/2017-Central Tax dated 16th November, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The total number of working days including examination days shall not be less than 234 days and total number of instructional days shall not be less than 200 days during the academic year, 2017-2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the 1st Summative/Mid-Term Examination be held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 1st Summative/Mid-Term Examination shall be held preferably from 9th October, 2017 and the 2nd Summative/Terminal Examination shall be held preferably before 30th March, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the examination results be declared?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The examination results shall not be declared before 30th April, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the formative assessment be conducted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The formative assessment shall be conducted as per the convenience of the School and remaining hours of the days should be utilized for regular classes after formative assessment is over.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum number of instructional hours per day for the School?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The School instructional hours shall not be less than 5 hours 30 minutes per day, exclusive of School recess.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be entitled for the above discretionary holidays?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The non teaching staff of the School will be entitled for the above discretionary holidays, however they are not entitled for restricted holidays.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who shall not be eligible for vacation/Break?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Non-vocational staff shall not be eligible for vacation/Break.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When should the Second Terms examination be held?

question_answer_pairs.answer: The total number of working days including examination days shall not be less than 234 days and total number of instructional days shall not be less than 200 days during the academic year, 2017-2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the 1st Summative/Mid-Term Examination be held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 1st Summative/Mid-Term Examination shall be held preferably from 9th October, 2017 and the 2nd Summative/Terminal Examination shall be held preferably before 30th March, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the examination results be declared?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The examination results shall not be declared before 30th April, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the formative assessment be conducted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The formative assessment shall be conducted as per the convenience of the School and remaining hours of the days should be utilized for regular classes after formative assessment is over.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum number of instructional hours per day for the School?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The School instructional hours shall not be less than 5 hours 30 minutes per day, exclusive of School recess.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be entitled for the above discretionary holidays?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The non teaching staff of the School will be entitled for the above discretionary holidays, however they are not entitled for restricted holidays.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who shall not be eligible for vacation/Break?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Non-vocational staff shall not be eligible for vacation/Break.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When should the Second Terms examination be held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Second Terms examination should be held only after completion of 200 instructional days.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the timing of the School be adjusted without altering the total number of periods?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Accordingly, the timing of the School is to be adjusted without altering the total number of periods.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Director of Education?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (G. P. Bhat) is the Director of Education.
